results.title: Young Migrants Crowd Shelters, Posing Test for Biden
results.abstract: The administration is under intensifying pressure to expand its capacity to care for as many as 35,000 unaccompanied minors, part of a wave of people crossing the border.
results.byline: By Michael D. Shear, Zolan Kanno-Youngs and Eileen Sullivan

multimedia.caption: A group of migrants waiting in La Joya, Texas, to board a bus from Customs and Border Protection after crossing the Rio Grande in March. Last month, border agents encountered nearly 19,000 children at the border.

results.title: 'I Have No Idea Where My Daughter Is': Migrant Parents Are Desperate for News
results.abstract: With a record 20,000 migrant children in shelters and detention facilities, many parents have waited weeks to learn what happened to their children after they crossed the border.

multimedia.caption: Maria Ana Mendez, left, got a phone call when her daughter Cindy arrived in the United States from Guatemala, but then waited weeks to hear her voice again. They were reunited in San Diego this week.
multimedia.copyright: Ariana Drehsler for The New York Times
